subcategories.name: Triage/Gestalt
items: Quickly scroll through thicker sections
Compare to normal anatomy
Identify areas of concern
Compare to prior studies if available

subcategories.name: Scout/Localizer Images
items: Review scout images for anatomy
Check for support devices
Identify free air or large pathology

subcategories.name: History and Indication
items: Review clinical history for chest pain and shortness of breath
Assess prior imaging studies

subcategories.name: Adequacy of Images
items: Evaluate technique and limitations
Check for thin reconstructions and reformats
Ensure entire thorax is included
Assess for motion degradation and artifacts

subcategories.name: Support Devices
items: Check positioning of tubes and lines
Look for complications of support devices
Assess for chronic thrombosis around intravascular devices

subcategories.name: Airways
items: Assess trachea for patency and caliber
Follow airways to segmental and subsegmental levels
Look for endobronchial lesions
Evaluate bronchi for bronchiectasis or wall thickening

subcategories.name: Pleura
items: Check for pleural effusion and pneumothorax
Assess density and loculation of effusion
Look for pleural thickening, nodules, or calcifications

subcategories.name: Lungs
items: Identify consolidation, masses, or ground glass opacities
Look for abnormal lucencies or interstitial changes
Check for nodules and masses
Use MIPs for small nodules

subcategories.name: Heart
items: Evaluate pericardium for effusion or masses
Assess heart size and chamber dimensions
Check for wall thinning or contour abnormalities
Look for masses or thrombus in chambers

subcategories.name: Vascular Assessment
items: Check SVC, IVC, and tributaries for clots or masses
Evaluate pulmonary arteries for filling defects
Assess pulmonary veins for abnormalities
Examine aorta for aneurysms or dissections

subcategories.name: Lymph Nodes
items: Search axillary and mediastinal lymph nodes
Evaluate for adenopathy in specific stations

subcategories.name: Mediastinum and Esophagus
items: Look for mass lesions or fluid in the mediastinum
Examine esophagus for thickening or masses

subcategories.name: Lower Neck
items: Check thyroid for nodules or enlargement
Assess supraclavicular fossae for adenopathy

subcategories.name: Upper Abdomen
items: Look for free air or fluid
Evaluate liver, gallbladder, pancreas, and kidneys
Check for enlarged lymph nodes or ascites

subcategories.name: Osseous Structures
items: Assess bony morphology and density
Look for fractures or lesions in ribs and sternum
Evaluate spinal alignment and vertebral bodies

subcategories.name: Musculature
items: Check for mass lesions or atrophy in chest wall muscles
Look for enhancing lesions if IV contrast was used

subcategories.name: Subcutaneous Soft Tissues
items: Evaluate for nodules, edema, or abnormal thickening
Check breast tissues for abnormalities

subcategories.name: Proofreading
items: Ensure findings correlate with clinical history
Look for life-threatening conditions
Confirm evaluation of relevant etiologies
